We want to calculate the conditional probabilities P(F|not H) and P(G|not H), which represent the chances that the creature is a Fizo or a Glom, respectively, given that it doesn't play the harmonica. We can use Bayes' theorem to express these probabilities in terms of the prior probabilities P(F) and P(G), and the likelihoods P(not H|F) and P(not H|G):

P(F|not H) = P(not H|F) P(F) / P(not H)
P(G|not H) = P(not H|G) P(G) / P(not H)

The denominator P(not H) is the probability of not playing the harmonica, which can be calculated as:

P(not H) = P(not H|F) P(F) + P(not H|G) P(G)
